x-redlock-auth.description: The x-redlock-auth value is a JSON Web Token (JWT).
x-redlock-auth.name: x-redlock-auth

CreateDataPatternRequest.description: Create/Update Pattern Model with limited input

DataPatternList.description: DataPattern List with Filters for UI

delimiter.description: Delimiter to separate the regex and weight in UI

DataProfile.description: Model class for Create and Update Data Profile

GetDataPatternFilterRequest.description: Get data pattern with filters on mode, updatedBy and time range

relativeTimeType.description: Direction in which to count time. Default = BACKWARD

sizeReportingFrequency.description: Frequency of the s3 inventory configuration

resourceRrn.description: Resource RRN to link to resource page

dssAndWildfireEligibleSize.description: Total size eligible for both Data Security scan and Wildfire

dssEligibleSize.description: Total size eligible for Data Security scan

isInventoryConfigured.description: Status of inventory configuration for current bucket. true = inventory configured

isScanComplete.description: Status of size estimation. true = scan complete

sensitiveEligiblePubliclyExposed.description: Total size for publicly exposed files eligible for DSS scan

UpdateResourceConfig.description: Model for Data Security resource scan config

enableScanning.description: Scan status. true = enable scans. false = disable scans

scanOption.description: Scan option. Required if **enableScanning** is true. 0 = Exposure only, 2 = All

scanType.description: Scan type. Required if **enableScanning** is true. 1 = forward and backward, 2 = forward

info.description:
Prisma Cloud Data Security enables you to discover and classify data stored 
in AWS S3 buckets and protect accidental exposure, misuse, or sharing of sensitive data. You can use
the data security settings APIs to manage data profiles, data patterns, and snippets.

### Error Handling

As with other Prisma Cloud public API requests, Data Security Settings API requests return standard 
HTTP response codes. When more details are available, the error response includes the following:

Property  | Type | Description  
-----------| ---- | ----------- 
message | string | Error message
name | string | Exception name
detail | string  | Exception details      

To get started with data security, see 
[Prisma Cloud Data Security](https://docs.prismacloud.io/en/classic/cspm-admin-guide/prisma-cloud-data-security/prisma-cloud-data-security). 
If you are upgraded to the Darwin release, 
see [Prisma Cloud Data Security](https://docs.prismacloud.io/en/enterprise-edition/content-collections/administration/configure-data-security/configure-data-security).
info.title: Prisma Cloud Data Security Settings API Overview

get.description: Lists all AWS S3 bucket resources for your onboarded cloud account(s). The response indicates the amount of data eligible for sensitive data scans, malware scans, or both based on the supported file types and file size.

put.description: Updates the data security scan settings configuration for the listed resources.
Lists all data patterns that satisfy the request filters.

get.description: Returns the data pattern details for the specified ID.
Lists of all data pattern names with their supported confidence levels.
Lists all data profiles for your tenant.

put.description: Enables or disables one or more data profiles.

get.description: Returns data profile details for the specified profile ID.
Returns the snippet masking configuration for your tenant.

post.description: Updates the snippet masking configuration for your tenant.
